page.title: 20THE RAILWAYS IN BARROW
page.content: The Midland line in Barrow upon Soar was built in 1840 and served local industry, local people and the Quorn Hunt, whose Kennels are to be found on Melton Lane. The Great Central Railway Act of 1893 enabled work to start in 1895 on the line between Loughborough and Leicester by-passing Barrow but with a station at Quorn and Woodhouse. The stations were used in the war years '39-'45 by the Government for the delivery of ammunition.The Prince of Wales used the station when he came hunting. After 1926 and the General Strike the Railways went steadily downhill and became less prosperous. Barrow upon Soar no longer has a station. It was axed in the 1960's.Crossley Close is built on the site of the old station. Barrow upon Soar has 3 bridges which are used by road traffic and 1 footbridge.{CLASS 7
